Detailed Description

Base class for all file encryption / decryption ciphers.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ FileCipherAbstract()

IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::FileCipherAbstract ( ISFileCryptoCipherBase *  pCipher)
Parameters
[in]pCipherCipher to use to encrypt/decrypt files.

Member Function Documentation

◆ Decrypt() [1/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Decrypt ( array< System::Byte >^  mpbArrayCipherText,
array< System::Byte >^ %  mpbArrayPlainTextOut 
)
virtual

Decrypts an input buffer into an output buffer.

Parameters
[in]mpbArrayCipherTextThe binary ciphertext input buffer.
[in]mpbArrayPlainTextOutThe binary plaintext output buffer.

This function performs file decryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException, AccessDeniedException or SdkException.

◆ Decrypt() [2/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Decrypt ( array< System::Byte >^  mpbArrayCipherText,
array< System::Byte >^ %  mpbArrayPlainTextOut,
FileCryptoDecryptAttributes^ %  attributesOut 
)
virtual

Decrypts an input buffer into an output buffer.

Parameters
[in]mpbArrayCipherTextThe binary ciphertext input buffer.
[in]mpbArrayPlainTextOutThe binary plaintext output buffer.
[out]attributesOutOptional object that will be populated with the detected file attributes.

This function performs file decryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException, AccessDeniedException or SdkException.

◆ Decrypt() [3/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Decrypt ( const String^  mwsFilePath)
virtual

Decrypts a file in-place.

Parameters
[in]mwsFilePathThe file path to be decrypted in place.

This function performs in-place file decryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

const String^  mwsDestPath 
)
virtual

Decrypts an input file into an output file.

Parameters
[in]mwsSourcePathThe input file path.
[in]mwsDestPathThe output file path.

This function performs file decryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException, AccessDeniedException, or SdkException.

◆ Decrypt() [6/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Decrypt ( const String^  mwsSourcePath,
const String^  mwsDestPath,
FileCryptoDecryptAttributes^ %  attributesOut 
)
virtual

Decrypts an input file into an output file.

Parameters
[in]mwsSourcePathThe input file path.
[in]mwsDestPathThe output file path.
[out]attributesOutOptional object that will be populated with the detected file attributes.

This function performs file decryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

If the source and destination paths point to the same physical file, then in-place decryption will be performed automatically. However, it is recommended to perform in-place decryption using the function dedicated for that purpose (FileCipherAbstract::Decrypt(const String^ mwsFilePath, FileCryptoDecryptAttributes^%)).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException, AccessDeniedException, or SdkException.

◆ Encrypt() [1/6]

array< System::Byte >^ %  mpbArrayCipherOut 
)
virtual

Encrypts an input byte buffer into an output byte buffer.

Parameters
[in]mpbArrayPlainTextThe binary plaintext input buffer.
[in]mpbArrayCipherOutThe binary ciphertext output buffer.

This function performs file encryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

virtual

Encrypts an input byte buffer into an output byte buffer.

Parameters
[in]mpbArrayPlainTextThe binary plaintext input buffer.
[in]mpbArrayCipherTextOutThe binary ciphertext output buffer.
[in,out]attributesOptional object that can provide input and output attributes.

This function performs file encryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

Encrypts a file in-place.

Parameters
[in]mwsFilePathThe file path to be encrypted in place.

This function performs in-place file encryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

◆ Encrypt() [5/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Encrypt ( const String^  mwsSourcePath,
const String^  mwsDestPath 
)
virtual

Encrypts an input file into an output file.

Parameters
[in]mwsSourcePathThe input file path.
[in]mwsDestPathThe output file path.

This function performs file encryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

If the source and destination paths point to the same physical file, then in-place encryption will be performed automatically. However, it is recommended to perform in-place encryption using the function dedicated for that purpose (FileCipherAbstract::Encrypt(const String^ mwsFilePath, FileCryptoEncryptAttributes^%)).

An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

Encrypts an input file into an output file.

Parameters

[in,out]attributesOptional object that can provide input and output attributes.

This function performs file encryption using the method implied by the class name (e.g. OpenXmlFileCipher).

If the source and destination paths point to the same physical file, then in-place encryption will be performed automatically. An exception will be thrown if any error occurs. If the exception is specific to the SDK, then the exception will be of type ServerException or SdkException.

◆ IsVersionSupported()

bool IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::IsVersionSupported ( const String^  mwsVersion)
virtual

Determines if a specific format version is supported by this cipher.

Parameters
[in]mwsVersionThe format version.
Returns
Returns true if the format version is supported. Otherwise, returns false.

Property Documentation

◆ Versions

virtual List< String^>^ IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCipherAbstract::Versions
get

A vector of the supported file format versions.

The vector of file format versions is ordered ascendingly by age (oldest to newest).
